title: Write a <geometry> once and reuse it

content.raw:
# Issue

It feels tedious to type or copy/paste `<geometry>` when multiple collisions/visuals use the same geometry. Making changes becomes prone to copy/paste errors when a lot of places have the same information.

# Proposal

* Add an optional attribute `name` to `<geometry>`
* Add a child tag `<uri>` that allows referencing a geometry by a scoped name


```xml
<model name="my_car">
  <link name="some_link">
    <visual name="its_visual">
      <geometry name="some_geom">
        <box><size>1 1 1</size></box>
      </geometry>
    </visual>
    <collision name="its_collision">
      <geometry>
        <uri>model://my_car/some_link/its_visual/some_geom</uri>
      </geometry>
    </visual>
   </link>
</model>
```


# Alternatives

An alternative to this proposal is to have a tag that contains geometries that can be referenced. This is similar to Collada's `<library_geometries>` ([Chapter 5 page 65](https://www.khronos.org/files/collada_spec_1_4.pdf))

Enhancement #75 could be an alternative to this proposal by allowing `<include>` to include `<geometry>`.
